extends Object
implements QRGenerator

      • generateQRCodeBase64Image

        public String generateQRCodeBase64Image(String autoStartToken,
                                        int width,
                                        int height,
                                        QRGenerator.ImageFormat format)
                                 throws IOException
        Generates a QR code image as a Base64 encoded image.

        For example: 

          data:image/png;base64, iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUA
 AAAFCAYAAACNbyblAAAAHElEQVQI12P4//8/w38GIAXDIBKE0DHxgljNBAAO
 9TXL0Y4OHwAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==

        The image may then be directly inserted in HTML code as: 

          <img src="data:image/png;base64, iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUA
 AAAFCAYAAACNbyblAAAAHElEQVQI12P4//8/w38GIAXDIBKE0DHxgljNBAAO
 9TXL0Y4OHwAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==" scale="0">
        Specified by:
        generateQRCodeBase64Image in interface QRGenerator
        Parameters:
        autoStartToken - the BankID autostart token
        width - the width of the generated QR code (in pixels)
        height - the height of the generated QR code (in pixels)
        format - the format for the generated QR code
        Returns:
        the base64 encoded image
        Throws:
        IOException - for errors during generation
        See Also:
        QRGenerator.generateQRCodeBase64Image(String)

      • generateQRCodeBase64Image

        public String generateQRCodeBase64Image(String autoStartToken)
                                 throws IOException
        Generates a QR code image as a Base64 encoded image using default settings for width, height and the image format.

      • setDefaultWidth

        public void setDefaultWidth(int defaultWidth)
        Assigns the default width (in pixels) to use for generated QR images.

        If not assigned, DEFAULT_WIDTH will be used.

        Parameters:
        defaultWidth - default width

      • setDefaultHeight

        public void setDefaultHeight(int defaultHeight)
        Assigns the default height (in pixels) to use for generated QR images.

        If not assigned, DEFAULT_HEIGHT will be used.

        Parameters:
        defaultHeight - default height

      • setDefaultImageFormat

        public void setDefaultImageFormat(QRGenerator.ImageFormat defaultImageFormat)
        Assigns the configured default image format to use for generated QR images.

        If not assigned, DEFAULT_IMAGE_FORMAT will be used.

        Parameters:
        defaultImageFormat - the default format
